title: The One Where Ross Finds Out

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Chandler and Joey's apartment. Chandler is answering the door in his robe.] CHAN: No, no, no, no, no, no [opens door to Monica] No. Monica, it's Sunday morning. I'm
not running on a Sunday. MNCA: Why not? CHAN: Because it's Sunday. It's God's day. MNCA: OK, if you say stop, then we stop. CHAN: OK, stop. MNCA: No, c'mon, we can't stop, c'mon, we've got three more pounds to go. I am the energy
train and you are on board. Woo-woo, woo-woo, woo-woo [Chandler walks out of the
apartment, leaving Monica] Woo. [Scene: Rachel and Monica's apartment. Rachel is taking asprin. Ross enters.] ROSS: Hey Rach. RACH: Ahhhh. ROSS: Oh. And how was the date? RACH: Umm, I think there was a restaurant... I know there was wine. . . [Rachel looks at Ross as though she remembers something, but can't place what it is.]

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Wow, well uh, uh, actually, Julie's downstairs getting a cab, I just need the cat toy, did Monica say. . . What? Why, why are you looking at me like that?

dialogue.speaker: RACH
dialogue.text: I don't know, I, I feel like I had a dream about you last night but I,

dialogue.speaker:
I DON'T
REMEMBER. ROSS
dialogue.text: OK. Oh, oh, oh. [runs over and picks up the cat toy]

dialogue.speaker: RACH
dialogue.text: Did we speak on the phone last night? Did you call me?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: No, I sta

dialogue.speaker: HUH. ROSS
dialogue.text: Oh, actually I haven't even been home yet. Do you mind if I check my messages?

dialogue.speaker: RACH
dialogue.text: Oh yeah, go ahead. [Rachel walks in her room. Ross picks up the phone and dials his machine to check his messages.]

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Rach, I got a message from you. [pauses] Who's Michael? [Rachel comes out of her room, suddenly she remembers leaving the message.]

dialogue.speaker: RACH
dialogue.text: Oh my God. Oh my God Ross, no, hang up the phone, give me the phone Ross, give me the phone, give me the phone, give me the. . . [jumps the couch and lands on Ross's back, finally getting the phone from him. Ross has a confused expression on his face.]

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: You're over me?

dialogue.speaker: RACH
dialogue.text: Ohhhhhhhh God. [climbs off his back]

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Wha... you're uh, you're, you're over me?

dialogue.speaker: RACH
dialogue.text: Ohh,

dialogue.speaker: OHH. ROSS
dialogue.text: When, when were you... under me? Rach. Rachel do you, I mean, were you, uh. . . What?

dialogue.speaker: RACH
dialogue.text: Ohh, OK, OK, OK, well, basically, lately, I've uh, I've uh, sor

dialogue.speaker: RACH
dialogue.text: Yeah, what, so? You

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER TOLD ME. ROSS
dialogue.text: Chandler. When did he... when did he... when did he?

dialogue.speaker: MEETING JULIE. ROSS
dialogue.text: Julie. Julie. That. Oh God. Julie, right. OK, I need to lie down. No, ya know, I'm gonna stand. I'm gonna stand, I'm gonna walk, I'm walkin' and I am standing. OK so you uh, and now wha... and now, now, now you're over me?

dialogue.speaker: RACH
dialogue.text: Are you over me? [A moment of silence.]

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: [doorbell buzzes] That's, that's Julie. Ju... Julie, Julie. [talks on intercom]

dialogue.speaker:
HI
JULIE. JULIE
dialogue.text: [over intercom] Hi honey,

dialogue.speaker: I'VE GOT A CAB WAITING. ROSS
dialogue.text: [perky]

dialogue.speaker: I'LL BE RIGHT DOWN. RACH
dialogue.text: Wait, so, you're going?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Well, OK, I uh, I have to. I can't deal with this right now. I mean, I've uh, y'know, I've got a cab, I've got a girlfriend, I'm...

dialogue.speaker: I'M GONNA GO GET A CAT. RACH
dialogue.text: OK,

dialogue.speaker: OK. ROSS
dialogue.text: Cat. [leaves] [

dialogue.speaker: SCENE
dialogue.text: Chandler and Joey's apartment. Joey is watching a rabbi play an electric guitar on TV. Phoebe enters.]

dialogue.speaker: HEY PHOEBS. PHOE
dialogue.text: How come you're watching a rabbi play electric guitar?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: I can't find the remote. [Phoebe turns off the TV]

dialogue.speaker: THANK YOU. PHOE
dialogue.text: So, Scott asked me to come over

dialogue.speaker: AND WE DID. JOEY
dialogue.text: All right Phoebs,

dialogue.speaker: YAY ME. JOEY
dialogue.text: So, so how did it happen?

dialogue.speaker: PHOE
dialogue.text: Well, I finally took your advice and as

dialogue.speaker: PHOE
dialogue.text: He said that, um, he understands how sex can be like, a very emotional thing for a woman and he was just afraid that I was gonna get all, y'know, like, 'ohh, is he gonna call me the next day' and, y'know, 'where is this going' and, ya know, blah-la-la-la-la. So he said he wanted to hold off until he was prep

dialogue.speaker: WOW. PHOE
dialogue.text: Yeah, so I said, "OK, relax please," y'know, I mean, sex can be just about two people right there in the moment, y'know, it's, if he wants to see me again he can call and if not, that's fine too. So after a looooot of tal

dialogue.speaker: UM-HUM. JOEY
dialogue.text: This man is my God. [

dialogue.speaker: SCENE
dialogue.text: Central Perk. Rachel is closing up and Ross comes in. Get your Kleenex.]

dialogue.speaker: I DIDN'T GET A CAT. RACH
dialogue.text: Oh, that's um,

dialogue.speaker: INTERESTING. ROSS
dialogue.text: No, no it's not interesting. OK, it's very, very not interesting. In fact it's actually 100 percent completel

dialogue.speaker: I GOT IT ROSS. ROSS
dialogue.text: You had no right to tell me you

dialogue.speaker: EVER HAD FEELINGS FOR ME. RACH
dialogue.text: [hurt] What?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I was doing great with Julie bef

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Then you should have said s

dialogue.speaker: OR ITALIAN GUYS. RACH
dialogue.text: Hey, there was one Italian guy, OK, and do you even have a point?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: The point is I... I don't need this right now, OK. It, it's too late, I'm with somebody else, I'm ha

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Hey, I've been doin' it since the ninth grade, I've gott

dialogue.speaker: FINE. RACH
dialogue.text: 'Cause I do

dialogue.speaker: GOOD. RACH
dialogue.text: Good. [Ross leaves]

dialogue.speaker: RACH
dialogue.text: And ya know what, now I've got closure. [Rachel slams the door and locks it. She sits down, visibly upset. She puts her head in her hands and begins to cry. Ross comes back and is standing outside the window. When Rachel regroups and gets back up to finish closing, she sees him. She smiles. She goes to open the door and can't get the lock undone.]

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Try the bottom one. [She opens the door and they kiss.] [

dialogue.speaker: SCENE
dialogue.text: Chandler and Joey's apartment. Chandler answers the door to find Monica.]

dialogue.speaker: CLOSING CREDITS CHAN
dialogue.text: Monica, it's 6:30 in the morning. We're not working out,

dialogue.speaker: IT'S OVER. MNCA
dialogue.text: No way, with one pound to go, c'mon. We're workin', we're movin', we're i

dialogue.speaker: CHAN
dialogue.text: Nothing, except tell you, uh, I think it's wonderful

dialogue.speaker: HOW MUCH ENERGY YOU HAVE. MNCA
dialogue.text: Well,

dialogue.speaker: THANKS. CHAN
dialogue.text: I mean, especially considering how tough it's

dialogue.speaker: YOU KNOW. CHAN
dialogue.text: You know, I mean, you can't tell your parents you were fired becau

dialogue.speaker: UH-HUH. CHAN
dialogue.text: And it's not as if you have a boyfr

dialogue.speaker: BUT UM. CHAN
dialogue.text: I mean, if it were me, I think I'd have difficulty just

dialogue.speaker: TRY TO STAY POSITIVE. . . CHAN
dialogue.text: So, you feel like goin' for a run?

dialogue.speaker: ALRIGHT. CHAN
dialogue.text: Because, you know, you don't have to. If you want, you could j

dialogue.speaker: JUST FOR A LITTLE WHILE. CHAN
dialogue.text: OK. [Puts an afghan over her and dances into his room]
